title: Abstract Wiki Frame: Software / protocol / standard entity

main_entity.description: Core entity being described (typically the software, website, protocol, or standard itself). The exact shape follows semantics.types.Entity.

product_kind.description: Coarse product kind label, e.g. 'software', 'website', 'protocol', 'standard'. For most cases this will simply be 'software'.

category_lemmas.description: Lemmas describing the coarse category or categories of the artifact, e.g. 'operating system', 'web browser', 'cryptocurrency exchange'.

descriptor_lemmas.description: Additional descriptor lemmas that refine the type, e.g. 'open-source', 'free', 'proprietary', 'distributed', 'clientâ€“server'.

developers.description: Entities primarily responsible for developing the artifact (individuals, companies, or organizations).

maintainers.description: Entities currently maintaining the artifact, if distinct from the original developers.

standards_bodies.description: Entities (standards bodies, consortia, etc.) that formally own or steward the standard or protocol.

origin_location.description: Optional place or jurisdiction associated with the origin of the software or standard (e.g. 'United States', 'European Union', a city).

initial_release.description: Optional time span or date structure representing the initial public release (or adoption) of the artifact.

latest_release.description: Optional time span or date structure representing the latest notable release of the artifact.

current_version.description: Human-readable label for the current version or specification, if applicable (e.g. '3.2.1', 'HTTP/2').

current_version_time.description: Optional time span or date structure representing when the current version was released or adopted.

target_platform_entities.description: Entities representing platforms or environments that this software/protocol targets, e.g. operating systems, browsers, or hardware platforms.

target_platform_tags.description: String tags for target platforms, e.g. 'Windows', 'Linux', 'Android', 'iOS', when entity modelling is not available or not needed.

license_lemmas.description: Lemmas naming the license(s) used by the software or standard, e.g. 'GPL', 'MIT License', 'proprietary'.

programming_language_lemmas.description: Lemmas naming main implementation or interface languages, e.g. 'C++', 'Python', 'JavaScript'.

protocol_layers.description: Textual labels indicating protocol stack layers or roles, e.g. 'application layer', 'transport layer', 'network layer'.

domains.description: Application or industry domains for the artifact, e.g. 'web', 'cryptography', 'networking', 'finance', 'messaging'.

status.description: Lifecycle status of the artifact, e.g. 'active', 'deprecated', 'discontinued', 'draft', 'standard'.

open_standard.description: Whether the protocol or standard is considered an open standard (true), clearly not open (false), or unknown (null).

website_url.description: Official website or project homepage URL, if known.

related_entities.description: Mapping from relation labels (e.g. 'predecessor', 'successor', 'compatible_with', 'implements') to lists of related entities.

attributes.description: Free-form attribute bag for additional, lightly structured information not yet promoted to first-class fields.

extra.description: Reserved for pipeline- or source-specific metadata that should not affect generation but may be useful for debugging or analysis.

artifact_kind.description: Legacy field: coarse artifact kind, e.g. 'software', 'website', 'protocol', 'standard'. Prefer 'product_kind' and 'category_lemmas' for new data.

developer_or_maintainer.description: Legacy field: combined list of entities that develop or maintain the artifact. Prefer 'developers' and 'maintainers' in new data.

initial_release_event.description: Legacy field: event-style structure describing the initial release. Prefer 'initial_release' (time span) plus narrative events for detailed histories.

latest_release_version.description: Legacy field: textual label for the latest release version. Prefer 'current_version'.

latest_release_time.description: Legacy field: time span or date structure for latest release. Prefer 'latest_release' or 'current_version_time'.

license.description: Legacy field: main license label. Prefer 'license_lemmas' for structured data.

platforms.description: Legacy field: string list of supported platforms. Prefer 'target_platform_entities' and 'target_platform_tags'.

supported_protocols_or_standards.description: Legacy field: list of protocol or standard names supported or implemented by the artifact. New data may prefer explicit 'related_entities' relations or narrative frames.
